H0.text: An atom is the water formed when hydrogen and oxygen combine in this reaction.

H1.text: A reactant is the water in the reaction where hydrogen and oxygen combine to form water.

H2.text: An element is the description of the water produced when hydrogen and oxygen combine.

H3.text: A compound is the water formed when hydrogen and oxygen combine.

A4.text: A chemical compound is a chemical substance composed of many identical molecules containing atoms from more than one chemical element held together by chemical bonds.

A5.text: A molecule consisting of atoms of only one element is therefore not a compound.
